sen.j: 内海 次郎（うつみ じろう、天保7年（1836年） - ?）は、武蔵国川越市出身の新選組隊士。
sen.e: Jiro Utsumi (1836 - ?) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Kawagoe City, Musashi Province.
Jiro UTSUMI (1836 - ?) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Kawagoe City, Musashi Province.
sen.cmt: Utsumi を大文字に変更しました。
sen.e: Jiro UTSUMI (1836 - ?) was a member of Shinsengumi (a group who guarded Kyoto during the end of Tokugawa Shogunate) from Kawagoe City, Musashi Province.
He later became a Goryo-eji (guard of Imperial mausoleums).
He later became a Goryo-eji (guard of Imperial mausoleums).
He later became a Goryo-eji (guard of Imperial mausoleums).
His name is usually spelled 次郎, but it is also spelled 二郎.
His name is usually spelled 次郎, but it is also spelled 二郎.
His name is usually spelled 次郎, but it is also spelled 二郎.

sen.j: 元治元年（1864年）に、伊東甲子太郎らと共に新選組に入隊。
sen.e: He joined Shinsengumi on 1864 with Kashitaro ITO and others.
He joined Shinsengumi in 1864 with Kashitaro ITO and others.
sen.cmt: on を in に変更しました。
sen.e: He joined Shinsengumi in 1864 with Kashitaro ITO and others.

sen.j: 慶応2年（1866年）9月の三条制札事件に出動し、慶応3年（1867年）3月に伊東甲子太郎らと同意して御陵衛士を結成。
sen.e: He turned out to the Sanjo-ohashi Bridge Noticeboard Incident in October 1866, and formed Goryo-eji agreeing with Kashitaro Ito and others in April, 1867.
He turned out to the Sanjo-ohashi Bridge Noticeboard Incident in October 1866, and formed Goryo-eji agreeing with Kashitaro I and others in April, 1867.
He turned out to the Sanjo-ohashi Bridge Noticeboard Incident in October 1866, and formed Goryo-eji agreeing with Kashitaro I and others in April, 1867.
He seceded from Shinsengumi..
He seceded from Shinsengumi.
sen.cmt: 最後のピリオドを削除しました。
sen.e: He seceded from Shinsengumi.

sen.j: 油小路の変時は、阿部十郎と共に外出中だったため難を逃れ、薩摩藩に属した後、近藤勇襲撃に加わった。
sen.e: At Aburanokoji Incident, he got out of trouble because he was out with Juro ABE, and after belonging to Satsuma clan, he joined the attack on Isami KONDO.
At Aburanokoji Incident, he got out of trouble because he was out with Juro ABE, and after belonging to Satsuma clan, he joined the attack on Isami KONDO.
At Aburanokoji Incident, he got out of trouble because he was out with Juro ABE, and after belonging to Satsuma clan, he joined the attack on Isami KONDO.

sen.j: 戊辰戦争には新政府軍として参戦。
sen.e: He fought in the Boshin War on the New government army side.
He fought in the Boshin War on the New government army side.
He fought in the Boshin War on the New government army side.

sen.j: 明治2年（1869年）には戒光寺に御陵衛士墓碑を建立する。
sen.e: In 1869, he built a gravestone of Goryo-eji in Kaiko-ji Temple.
In 1869, he built a gravestone of Goryo-eji in Kaiko-ji Temple.
In 1869, he built a gravestone of Goryo-eji in Kaiko-ji Temple.
His whereabouts after that is unknown.
His whereabouts after that is unknown.
His whereabouts after that is unknown.
